document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Tillicera genus group with a revision of Plathanocera Schenkling (Coleoptera, Cleridae, Clerinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Tillicera genus group with a revision of Plathanocera Schenkling (Coleoptera, Cleridae, Clerinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Specimens examined:
Apopempsis ater Pic, 1932
,
Lectotype
(designated here): Musée du Congo , Elisabethville ,
XI.1911
, Miss. Agric. ; Apopempsis ater n.sp. ; R. Det. , Y, 2224,
Type
( MRAC )
;
Paralectotypes
(designated here): Musée du Congo , Elisabethville ,
XI.1911
, Miss. Agric. ; Apopempsis ater n.sp. ; R. Det. , Y, 2224, antennis ciergis,
Type
( MRAC )
;
Musée du Congo , Elisabethville ,
13-XI-1911
, Miss. Agric. ; permut 1916, ex coll. M. Pic ; Plathanocera atra Pic ; Cotype Apopempsis ater 1932 Pic ; NCBN type 2085.1 ( NCBN )
;
Coll. Mus. Congo , Kafakumba ,
XI-1933
, G.F. Overlaet ; Cotype ; Apopempsis ater Pic ; NCBN type 2085.2 ( NCBN )
.

Comment on the type specimens: As Pic (1932: 6) made no reference to type specimens in his descriptions of
Apopempsis ater
, it cannot be assumed that the nominal species-group name,
Apopempsis ater
, was based on a single specimen. The 'type' specimen located in the Musée Royal de l’Afrique Central, Tervuren (MRAC) must therefore considered a syntype ( ICZN 1999: Article 73.2 ) and available for lectotype designation ( ICZN 1999: Article 74.1 ). Further specimens from Netherlands Center for Biodiversity Naturalis (NCBN) and Museum National d’Histoire Naturelle, Paris (MNHN), are designated paralectotypes.

Apopempsis ensellatus Pic, 1933
does not belong in
Apopempsis
and is here transferred to
Oxystigmatium Kraatz, 1899
as
Oxystigmatium ensellatum ( Pic, 1933 )
n. comb.

Apopempsis apicalis Pic, 1932
does not correspond to the genus
Apopempsis
and is excluded; the correct genus placement of this species is yet to be determined.

Head: Head including eyes broader than anterior width of pronotum. Antennae slightly protruding base of pronotum when laid back. A4 slightly shorter than A3 and slightly dilated distally, A5 as long as A4, conspicuously dilated distally, A6–A10 enlarged, broader than long, more or less cordate, A11 long, slightly tapering apically. Frons with broad, longitudinal, slightly elevated gibbosity and laterally with slight flattened pit. Gular process broad and long.

Thorax: Pronotum conspicuously broader than long (length to width index 0.62:1–0.66:1), broadest before middle. Prosternal process long, narrow, not dilated distally; postcoxal projection of hypomeron acute, widely separated. Metendosternite stout, furcal arms straight, furcal lamina ovate, furcal stalk with broad base. Anterior mesoventral process triangular, slightly pointed, not margined.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Apopempsis
. (A) habitus, (B) antenna, (C) metendosternite, (D) distribution, (E) hind wing, (F) gula, (G) anterior mesoventral process.

subSubSection.paragraph: Elytra: Elytra longer than broad (length to width index 1.62:1–1.92:1); elytra domed, dilated towards apex, broadest behind middle, rows of punctures regular and deep, punctation transverse-ovate to square; interstices with conspicuous microsculpture.

Hind wings: AA3, AA4, MP4 and MP3 reaching the wing’s margin, CuA1 completely reduced. Legs: Tarsal pulvillar formula 4-3-2; protarsal pulvillus I more or less straight, emarginate or slightly lobed, II–IV increasingly deeply lobed; mesotarsus I only with small, linguiform pad, mesotarsal sole II small, short, not broad, slightly lobed, III and IV increasingly deeply lobed; metatarsus I with tiny pad (almost not visible), metatarsus II with pad, metatarsal soles III and IV increasingly deeply lobed; tibiae without carinae. Distribution: Cameroon ,
Congo
, Zambia , Zimbabwe .
